meanings.definition: To impede or prevent progress or action.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain will stimy our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: Don't let fear stimy you from chasing your dreams.
meanings.sent3: Trying to tie your shoelaces with mittens on will definitely stimy your efforts.
meanings.sent4: The tangled wires seemed to stimy any hope of fixing the broken lamp.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog was a dense wall that stimied our path forward.

meanings.definition: A situation or condition that impedes progress or action.
meanings.sent1: Lack of funding was a major stimy in completing the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was a huge stimy for commuters trying to get to work.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage was a real stimy during the important presentation.
meanings.sent4: The broken elevator was a constant stimy for residents living on the top floor.
meanings.sent5: The maze of bureaucracy proved to be a significant stimy in obtaining the necessary permits.
